title: Login
name: Login
description: Authenticates the user and returns the auth token. The token is also saved to a Redis store so it can be revoked at any time. It returns the token data and also the user info (like the user name, the profile, privileges and any other user info), to avoid unnecessary additional API calls.

Parameter.description: User name.
User password.

Success 200.description: The user object (as a relation, expanded by default)

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Logout
name: Logout
description: Deauthenticates the user by invalidating the token.

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Token renewal
name: TokenRenew
description: Creates a new token with a new expiry date without requiring the user to send again its credentials.

title: Token verification
name: Verify
description: Verifies if the token is valid and has not expired.

title: Activate a manager account
name: ActivateManager
description: Activate a manager account and set any additional details for that user (like the password)

title: Activate an user account
name: ActivateUser
description: Activate an user account and set any additional details for that user (like the profile)

Parameter.description: Username, must be unique.
Password.
Email,must be unique.
Nested objects to expand. It can be an array.

The methods that return multiple models are paginated by default. This determines the number of elements returned (by default 20). There's a hard limit (200). Requests with a greater value will return only the maximum allowed items.
The results page (for paginated results)

Sort criteria. Accepts multiple values (arrays or separated with commas). It also accepts the sort direction (if not provided, 'asc' will be used). Accepted values: 1, -1, asc, desc. Examples: ?sort=id ?sort=id|asc ?sort=id|asc,name|desc ?sort[]=id|asc&sort[]=name

title: Delete a user
name: Delete
description: Delete the user with this id

title: Create a password reset request
name: Create
description: Creates a password reset requests that allows the user to set a new password without providing the previous one. In order to set the new password, a new request must be performed to a temporary url with the new password (a mail will be sent to the user with a special temporary link that will perform that API request). When calling this method, either the username or the email must be provided.

Parameter.description: Username
Email

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Set a new password for the user associated to the password reset request
name: Update
description: Creates a password reset requests that allows the user to set a new password without providing the previous one. In order to set the new password, a new request must be performed to a temporary url with the new password (a mail will be sent to the user with a special temporary link that will perform that API request). When calling this method, either the username or the email must be provided.

Parameter.description: The new password
Username, must be unique.
Password.
Email,must be unique.

Parameter.description: Article title.
Article content.
Excerpt.
Publish status.
Publish date, as a timestamp. If published is true and the publish_date is provided, the post will not be published until that date.

Article tags, as objects (an array of this objects is accepted) The objects must have an id attribute for existing tags. If the tag does not have an ID it is assumed to be a new one and the creation of the tag will be attempted.
Nested objects to expand. It can be an array.

The methods that return multiple models are paginated by default. This determines the number of elements returned (by default 20). There's a hard limit (200). Requests with a greater value will return only the maximum allowed items.
The results page (for paginated results)

Sort criteria. Accepts multiple values (arrays or separated with commas). It also accepts the sort direction (if not provided, 'asc' will be used). Accepted values: 1, -1, asc, desc. Examples: ?sort=id ?sort=id|asc ?sort=id|asc,name|desc ?sort[]=id|asc&sort[]=name

name: Patch
description: Update the article with this id. Only provided values will be applied

Parameter.description: Article title.
Article content.

Slug. If there's already some post with the same slug, a numeric suffix will be added. For example, if the requested slug is foo and there's another post with that slug, the slug for this post will be foo-1
Excerpt.
Publish status.
Publish date, as a timestamp. If published is true and the publish_date is provided, the post will not be published until that date.

Article tags, as objects (an array of this objects is accepted) The objects must have an id attribute for existing tags. If the tag does not have an ID it is assumed to be a new one and the creation of the tag will be attempted.
Nested objects to expand. It can be an array.

The methods that return multiple models are paginated by default. This determines the number of elements returned (by default 20). There's a hard limit (200). Requests with a greater value will return only the maximum allowed items.
The results page (for paginated results)

Sort criteria. Accepts multiple values (arrays or separated with commas). It also accepts the sort direction (if not provided, 'asc' will be used). Accepted values: 1, -1, asc, desc. Examples: ?sort=id ?sort=id|asc ?sort=id|asc,name|desc ?sort[]=id|asc&sort[]=name

description: List all the articles tagged witth some tag
groupDescription:
Articles API endpoint for articles with some category.

This is exactly equal to KnowledgeBase/Articles except limiting the results to some tag.

title: Partial update an article
name: Patch
description: Update the article with this id. Only provided values will be applied
groupDescription:
Articles API endpoint for articles with some category.

This is exactly equal to KnowledgeBase/Articles except limiting the results to some tag.

title: Update an article
name: Update
description: Update the article with this id
groupDescription:
Articles API endpoint for articles with some category.

This is exactly equal to KnowledgeBase/Articles except limiting the results to some tag.

title: Create a new article
name: Create
description: Create a new article and assign it to the tag
groupDescription:
Articles API endpoint for articles tagged with some tag.

This is exactly equal to KnowledgeBase/Articles except limiting the results to some tag.

title: Delete an article
name: Delete
description: Delete the article with this id
groupDescription:
Articles API endpoint for articles tagged with some tag.

This is exactly equal to KnowledgeBase/Articles except limiting the results to some tag.

title: Get an article
name: Get
description: Get the article with that id (and with that tag)
groupDescription:
Articles API endpoint for articles tagged with some tag.

This is exactly equal to KnowledgeBase/Articles except limiting the results to some tag.

title: Update an article
name: Update
description: Update the article with this id
groupDescription:
Articles API endpoint for articles tagged with some tag.

This is exactly equal to KnowledgeBase/Articles except limiting the results to some tag.

Parameter.description: Tag name. (must be unique for this client)
} Tag description.
Nested objects to expand. It can be an array.

The methods that return multiple models are paginated by default. This determines the number of elements returned (by default 20). There's a hard limit (200). Requests with a greater value will return only the maximum allowed items.
The results page (for paginated results)

Sort criteria. Accepts multiple values (arrays or separated with commas). It also accepts the sort direction (if not provided, 'asc' will be used). Accepted values: 1, -1, asc, desc. Examples: ?sort=id ?sort=id|asc ?sort=id|asc,name|desc `?sort[]=id|asc&sort[]=name

Success 200.description: Articles that have the tag applied. Collapsed by default (only a meta node with the collection url and the item count). Can be expanded to the full tag objects (see the include parameter)

title: Partial update a tag
name: Patch
description: Update the tag with this id. Only provided values will be applied

Parameter.description: Tag name. (must be unique for this client)
Tag description.

Slug. If there's already some tag with the same slug, a numeric suffix will be added. For example, if the requested slug is foo and there's another tag with that slug, the slug for this tag will be foo-1
Nested objects to expand. It can be an array.

The methods that return multiple models are paginated by default. This determines the number of elements returned (by default 20). There's a hard limit (200). Requests with a greater value will return only the maximum allowed items.
The results page (for paginated results)

Sort criteria. Accepts multiple values (arrays or separated with commas). It also accepts the sort direction (if not provided, 'asc' will be used). Accepted values: 1, -1, asc, desc. Examples: ?sort=id ?sort=id|asc ?sort=id|asc,name|desc `?sort[]=id|asc&sort[]=name

Success 200.description: Articles that have the tag applied. Collapsed by default (only a meta node with the collection url and the item count). Can be expanded to the full tag objects (see the include parameter)

name: Update

title: API entry point
name: Index
description: Test route to make sure everything is working

examples.title: Success-Response:

Parameter.description: Title
Ticket content
Ticket category
Nested objects to expand. It can be an array.

The methods that return multiple models are paginated by default. This determines the number of elements returned (by default 20). There's a hard limit (200). Requests with a greater value will return only the maximum allowed items.
The results page (for paginated results)

Sort criteria. Accepts multiple values (arrays or separated with commas). It also accepts the sort direction (if not provided, 'asc' will be used). Accepted values: 1, -1, asc, desc. Examples: ?sort=id ?sort=id|asc ?sort=id|asc,name|desc ?sort[]=id|asc&sort[]=name

Success 200.description: Ticket closed status. If not present or has a false value, the ticket is open
Ticket owner. All the relations are collapsed by default (only a meta node with the entity url and the item count). Can be expanded to the full tag objects (see the include parameter)
Ticket comments (public comments, visible to the user, and private notes, only visible to the managers)

Parameter.description: The file
Nested objects to expand. It can be an array.

The methods that return multiple models are paginated by default. This determines the number of elements returned (by default 20). There's a hard limit (200). Requests with a greater value will return only the maximum allowed items.
The results page (for paginated results)

Sort criteria. Accepts multiple values (arrays or separated with commas). It also accepts the sort direction (if not provided, 'asc' will be used). Accepted values: 1, -1, asc, desc. Examples: ?sort=id ?sort=id|asc ?sort=id|asc,name|desc ?sort[]=id|asc&sort[]=name

Success 200.description: Host name, for the server where the file is (useful when uploading to S3)

title: Delete an upload
name: Delete
description: Delete the upload record with this id (and delete the file)

Success 200.description: Host name, for the server where the file is (useful when uploading to S3)
